titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Ruth Ellen Wasem interviews

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

archdesc.bioghist: Doctoral student in history at the University of Michigan.
archdesc.scopecontent: Interviews concerning the resurgence of the Michigan Democratic Party after World War II and state politics during the first years of the gubernatorial administration of G. Mennen Williams; contain transcripts and tapes of interviews with Neil Staebler, Robert C. Angell [tape only] and G. Mennen Williams.

c01.scopecontent: Interviews concerning the resurgence of the Michigan Democratic Party after World War II and state politics during the first years of the gubernatorial administration of G. Mennen Williams; contain transcripts and tapes of interviews with Neil Staebler, Robert C. Angell [tape only] and G. Mennen Williams.

Recordings of interviews conducted by Ruth Wasem, doctoral student in history at the University of Michigan, concerning the resurgence of the state Democratic Party after World War II, state politics during the first years of the gubernatorial administration of G. Mennen Williams; contain recordings of interviews with Neil Staebler, Robert C. Angell and G. Mennen Williams.
